# Reference Documentation

<!-- Generated by Copilot -->

> **Information-oriented** - Technical specifications and detailed information

## Quick Reference

### Project Structure

```
ExpenseVault.TransactionService/
├── ExpenseVault.TransactionService.API/           # API Layer (Port 9400)
├── ExpenseVault.TransactionService.Application/   # CQRS, DTOs, Validators
├── ExpenseVault.TransactionService.Domain/        # Entities, Value Objects
├── ExpenseVault.TransactionService.Infrastructure/ # EF Core, Persistence
├── ExpenseVault.SharedLibrary/                    # Shared components
└── tests/                                          # Unit & Integration tests
```

### Common Commands

```bash
# Build
dotnet build

# Test
dotnet test

# Run
cd ExpenseVault.TransactionService.API && dotnet run

# Docker
docker compose up -d
docker compose down

# Migrations
dotnet ef migrations add <Name> -p ExpenseVault.TransactionService.Infrastructure -s ExpenseVault.TransactionService.API
dotnet ef database update -p ExpenseVault.TransactionService.Infrastructure -s ExpenseVault.TransactionService.API
```

### API Endpoints

| Method | Endpoint | Description |
|--------|----------|-------------|
| POST | `/api/transactions` | Create transaction |
| GET | `/api/transactions/{id}` | Get by ID |
| GET | `/api/transactions/wallet/{walletId}` | Get by wallet (paged) |

### Configuration

| Setting | Default | Description |
|---------|---------|-------------|
| Port | 9400 | API port |
| Database | transactiondb | PostgreSQL database |
| Redis | localhost:6379 | Cache server |
| Cache Prefix | transaction: | HybridCache prefix |

## Reference Documentation Principles

Our reference docs follow these principles:

✅ **Information-oriented**: Describe how things work

✅ **Accurate**: Technically correct and up-to-date

✅ **Complete**: Cover all aspects

✅ **Consistent**: Predictable structure

✅ **Austere**: Stick to facts, no opinion
